content: [eyvind] It doesn't matter. Our only chance is to get to Sigrholm. Juno will know what to do.
[iver] I know you. Ubin? Never imagined you to be one to defy the king. What made you leave?
[iver] Must be me, then.
[iver narrator] Already? How is that possible?
[iver narrator] Don't let anyone tell you the dredge aren't clever. Einartoft will fall within a day.
[narrator] A group of varl from Wyrmtoe showed up around the back of Einartoft. The long way.
[narrator] Bellower is heading this way.
[narrator] Bellower and his army chased them across the Summer Path, they said.
[narrator eyvind] I thought one of you might know why.
[narrator] Greetings, Iver. It's been quite a while since we talked, hasn't it?
[narrator] He must have doubled back after that serpent appeared.
[narrator iver] Is there something I don't know? That's quite a grudge he's holding if he's coming for you, Iver.
[narrator iver] Someone had to.
[narrator] Maybe not. He's following you.
[narrator] We'll join you. I bring supplies and warriors, and my friend Gunnulf here bears a heavy sword. I believe he'd be happy to swing it for you.
[narrator] We'll join you. I come bearing supplies and warriors who would be happy to kill a dredge or two, I believe.
[narrator] While we fought on the bridge he led half his forces around to approach Einartoft from behind.
[rook narrator] The attack on the bridge was a feint?
[rook] Past Wyrmtoe? That doesn't make sense. Bellower was at the bridge.
[rook] What do you mean?
{skip} mark1=iver mark2=narrator mark3=rook mark4=eyvind
/=You exchange nervous glances but nobody speaks up.=/
